targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    toDateTime64(toStartOf${Granularity}(timestamp_in), 3) AS time_bucket,
    count(*) AS "count"
FROM server_logs
WHERE timestamp_in >= $__fromTime AND timestamp_in <= $__toTime
GROUP BY time_bucket
ORDER BY time_bucket
WITH FILL
FROM toDateTime64($__fromTime, 3)
TO toDateTime64($__toTime, 3)
STEP toInterval${Granularity}(1);

SELECT time_bucket, -sum(number) as "count"
FROM (
  SELECT 
    toDateTime64(toStartOf${Granularity}(timestamp_failed), 3) AS time_bucket,
    count(*) AS number
  FROM failed_dns_loglines
  WHERE timestamp_failed >= $__fromTime AND timestamp_failed <= $__toTime
  GROUP BY time_bucket
  ORDER BY time_bucket
  WITH FILL
  FROM toDateTime64($__fromTime, 3)
  TO toDateTime64($__toTime, 3)
  STEP toInterval${Granularity}(1)

  UNION ALL

  SELECT 
    toDateTime64(toStartOf${Granularity}(timestamp), 3) AS time_bucket,
    count(*) AS number
  FROM logline_timestamps
  WHERE status = 'filtered_out'
    AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  GROUP BY time_bucket
  ORDER BY time_bucket
  WITH FILL
  FROM toDateTime64($__fromTime, 3)
  TO toDateTime64($__toTime, 3)
  STEP toInterval${Granularity}(1)

  UNION ALL

  SELECT 
    toDateTime64(toStartOf${Granularity}(timestamp), 3) AS time_bucket,
    count(*) AS number
  FROM batch_timestamps
  WHERE status = 'filtered_out'
    AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  GROUP BY time_bucket
  ORDER BY time_bucket
  WITH FILL
  FROM toDateTime64($__fromTime, 3)
  TO toDateTime64($__toTime, 3)
  STEP toInterval${Granularity}(1)
)
GROUP BY time_bucket;

SELECT *
FROM (
      SELECT 'Suspicious' AS state, MIN(message_count) AS minimal_size, AVG(message_count) AS average_size, MAX(message_count) AS maximal_size, 3 as sort_order
      FROM suspicious_batch_timestamps
      WHERE stage = 'data_inspection.inspector' AND
            status = 'finished'

      UNION ALL

      SELECT 'Filtered' AS state, MIN(message_count) AS minimal_size, AVG(message_count) AS average_size, MAX(message_count) AS maximal_size, 2 as sort_order
      FROM batch_timestamps
      WHERE stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter' AND
            status = 'finished'

      UNION ALL

      SELECT 'Initial' AS state, MIN(message_count) AS minimal_size, AVG(message_count) AS average_size, MAX(message_count) AS maximal_size, 1 as sort_order
      FROM batch_timestamps
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler' AND
            status = 'completed'
)
ORDER BY sort_order ASC;

panels.title: TODO: How many have existed in what stage

targets.rawSql:
SELECT max(entry_count)
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_batches'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime

panels.title: Maximum Batch Size for Configured Timeout

targets.rawSql:
SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.collector'
  AND 'Collector' IN (${include_modules:csv})
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND 'Prefilter' IN (${include_modules:csv})
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'data_inspection.inspector'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND 'Inspector' IN (${include_modules:csv})
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'data_analysis.detector'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND 'Detector' IN (${include_modules:csv})
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_batches'
  AND 'BatchHandler' IN (${include_modules:csv})
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT *
FROM (
  SELECT 'Collector' AS name, median(value) AS "Median", 2 AS sort_order
  FROM (
    SELECT entry_count as value
    FROM fill_levels
    WHERE stage = 'log_collection.collector' AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  )

  UNION ALL

  SELECT 'BatchHandler' AS name, median(value) AS "Median", 3 AS sort_order
  FROM (
    SELECT entry_count as value
    FROM fill_levels
    WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler' AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_batches' AND
          timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  )

  UNION ALL

  SELECT 'Prefilter' AS name, median(value) AS "Median", 4 AS sort_order
  FROM (
    SELECT entry_count as value
    FROM fill_levels
    WHERE stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter' AND entry_type = 'total_loglines' AND
          timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  )

  UNION ALL

  SELECT 'Inspector' AS name, median(value) AS "Median", 5 AS sort_order
  FROM (
    SELECT entry_count as value
    FROM fill_levels
    WHERE stage = 'data_inspection.inspector' AND entry_type = 'total_loglines' AND
          timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  )

  UNION ALL

  SELECT 'Detector' AS name, median(value) AS "Median", 6 AS sort_order
  FROM (
    SELECT entry_count as value
    FROM fill_levels
    WHERE stage = 'data_analysis.detector' AND entry_type = 'total_loglines' AND
          timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
  )
)
WHERE name IN (${include_modules:csv})
ORDER BY sort_order ASC;

SELECT *
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.collector'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT median(entry_count) AS "Median"
FROM (
      SELECT *
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.collector'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT *
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT median(entry_count) AS "Median"
FROM (
      SELECT *
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT min(value) AS "Minimum", avg(value) AS "Average", max(value) AS "Maximum"
FROM (
      SELECT entry_count AS value
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.collector'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT min(value) AS "Minimum", avg(value) AS "Average", max(value) AS "Maximum"
FROM (
      SELECT entry_count AS value
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_batches'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT timestamp, entry_count AS " "
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_buffer'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT median(entry_count) AS "Batch Median"
FROM (
      SELECT *
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_batches'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT median(entry_count) AS "Buffer Median"
FROM (
      SELECT *
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_buffer'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT *
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'data_inspection.inspector'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT median(entry_count) AS "Median"
FROM (
      SELECT *
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'data_inspection.inspector'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT min(value) AS "Minimum", avg(value) AS "Average", max(value) AS "Maximum"
FROM (
      SELECT entry_count AS value
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_batches'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT min(value) AS "Minimum", avg(value) AS "Average", max(value) AS "Maximum"
FROM (
      SELECT entry_count AS value
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines_in_buffer'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT min(value) AS "Minimum", avg(value) AS "Average", max(value) AS "Maximum"
FROM (
      SELECT entry_count AS value
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'data_inspection.inspector'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT *
FROM fill_levels
WHERE stage = 'data_analysis.detector'
  AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
  AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY timestamp ASC;

SELECT median(entry_count) AS "Median"
FROM (
      SELECT *
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'data_analysis.detector'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT min(value) AS "Minimum", avg(value) AS "Average", max(value) AS "Maximum"
FROM (
      SELECT entry_count AS value
      FROM fill_levels
      WHERE stage = 'data_analysis.detector'
      AND entry_type = 'total_loglines'
      AND timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
)

SELECT 
    toStartOf${Granularity}(timestamp_in) AS time_bucket,
    count(*) AS lines
FROM failed_dns_loglines
WHERE timestamp_in >= $__fromTime AND timestamp_in <= $__toTime
GROUP BY time_bucket
ORDER BY time_bucket;

SELECT 
    toStartOf${Granularity}(timestamp) AS time_bucket,
    count(*) AS lines
FROM logline_timestamps
WHERE stage = 'log_collection.collector' AND
      status = 'in_process' AND
      timestamp >= $__fromTime AND timestamp <= $__toTime
GROUP BY time_bucket
ORDER BY time_bucket;

SELECT lt2.timestamp as time, dateDiff('microsecond', lt1.timestamp, lt2.timestamp) AS diff
FROM logline_timestamps lt1
INNER JOIN logline_to_batches ltb ON lt1.logline_id = ltb.logline_id
INNER JOIN batch_timestamps lt2 ON ltb.batch_id = lt2.batch_id
WHERE lt1.stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler' AND lt1.status = 'in_process' AND
      lt2.stage = 'log_collection.batch_handler' AND lt2.status = 'completed' AND
      lt1.timestamp >= $__fromTime AND lt2.timestamp <= $__toTime
ORDER BY time ASC;

SELECT t1.timestamp as time, dateDiff('microsecond', t1.timestamp, t2.timestamp) as time_in_module, median(time_in_module) OVER () AS median_line
FROM logline_timestamps t1, logline_timestamps t2
WHERE t1.logline_id = t2.logline_id AND
      t1.status = 'in_process' AND t2.status = 'finished' AND
      t1.stage = 'log_collection.collector' AND t2.stage = 'log_collection.collector' AND
      time >= $__fromTime AND time <= $__toTime
ORDER BY time ASC;

SELECT batch_id, (t2.message_count / t1.message_count) AS relevant_loglines
FROM batch_timestamps t1, batch_timestamps t2
WHERE t1.batch_id = t2.batch_id AND
      t1.stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter' AND
      t2.stage = 'log_filtering.prefilter' AND
      t1.status = 'in_process' AND
      (t2.status = 'finished' OR t2.status = 'filtered_out')
GROUP BY batch_id, t1.message_count, t2.message_count

panels.title: Average percentage of relevant log lines per Batch

targets.rawSql:
SELECT timestamps_per_second as "time", count(*) / count(DISTINCT timestamps_per_second) AS number_per_second
FROM failed_dns_loglines
GROUP BY date_trunc('second', timestamp_failed) AS timestamps_per_second, time
ORDER BY time ASC;

panels.title: Invalid DNS Log Lines per second

targets.rawSql:
SELECT timestamp_in AS time, dateDiff(microsecond, timestamp_in, event_timestamp) AS time_in_module, median(time_in_module) OVER () AS median_line
FROM server_logs, server_logs_timestamps
WHERE server_logs.message_id = server_logs_timestamps.message_id AND 
      event = 'timestamp_out' AND
      time >= $__fromTime AND time <= $__toTime
GROUP BY message_id, timestamp_in, event_timestamp
ORDER BY time ASC;

list.definition:
SELECT CASE 
    WHEN (dateDiff('minute', toDateTime($__fromTime), toDateTime($__toTime))) <= 5 THEN 'Second'
    WHEN (dateDiff('hour', toDateTime($__fromTime), toDateTime($__toTime))) <= 1 THEN 'Minute'
    WHEN (dateDiff('hour', toDateTime($__fromTime), toDateTime($__toTime))) <= 24 THEN 'Hour'
    ELSE 'Day'
END AS interval;
list.name: Granularity
list.query:
SELECT CASE 
    WHEN (dateDiff('minute', toDateTime($__fromTime), toDateTime($__toTime))) <= 5 THEN 'Second'
    WHEN (dateDiff('hour', toDateTime($__fromTime), toDateTime($__toTime))) <= 1 THEN 'Minute'
    WHEN (dateDiff('hour', toDateTime($__fromTime), toDateTime($__toTime))) <= 24 THEN 'Hour'
    ELSE 'Day'
END AS interval;

list.description: Modules to be included in the comparison graphs and charts
list.label: Include Modules
list.name: include_modules
list.query: LogServer : 'LogServer', Collector : 'Collector', BatchHandler : 'BatchHandler', Prefilter : 'Prefilter', Inspector : 'Inspector', Detector : 'Detector'
